message_1: What is the product of the reaction between propene and hydrogen bromide in the presence of a peroxide initiator?
message_2: The reaction between propene (C3H6) and hydrogen bromide (HBr) in the presence of a peroxide initiator follows the anti-Markovnikov rule due to the radical mechanism involved. The product of this reaction is 1-bromopropane (CH3-CH2-CH2-Br).
